I'm not seeing it till tomorrow

That's... Weird. Gimme some time

I got the same problem, the zip file has nothing in it. The filesize is 22 bytes
That's really weird... Anyone else have an alternate site besides media fire, GitHub and Kerbalstuff? None worked for me earlier
Dropbox and curse, both you need an account. Could be something on your end, not uploading ALL the files
Try and redo the archiving process. Then try again.
I just saw the movie. It was so good!!!
I won't be able to fix the download for a couple of hours, please stop sending me pms. I know the download doesn't work
The Tainyangshen from the movie looked nothing like this...

I don't like the new name for this mod. Why not "The Martian (Launch) Vehicle Mod" or something? "The Dunation Mod" doesn't really fit to this in my eyes.

@xxhansonmaxx: Well, I somehow felt like something like this would happen. Will you rework the vehicle, or just leave it?

I haven't started on Delta IX yet, and I won't until I saw the movie, I just hope that there are some good scenes with it.
They were kinda playing it cheap with their launch scenes, I think they were all from youtube. The rocket in the movie was a CZ-2 I think

They were kinda playing it cheap with their launch scenes, I think they were all from youtube. The rocket in the movie was a CZ-2 I think
Yep. The Delta IX was just an Atlas V.

And for the SpaceX crew delivery they showed EFT-1.

Ridley Scott may be a great director, but not a rocket scientist.

- - - Updated - - -

The Tainyangshen from the movie looked nothing like this...
Yes, it looked like a fat Cygnus/PMM combo launched on a CZ-2. We're doing it the way Weir said it looked.
And why would he have to be a rocket scientist? He most likely did I it because lifelike Animation in extraordinarily expensive.

And why would he have to be a rocket scientist? He most likely did I it because lifelike Animation in extraordinarily expensive.
He probably doesn't know about Delta, Titan, etc...
PEOPLE STOP PMING ME!!!!! I know the download doesnt work!!! Be patient!!!

Yep. The Delta IX was just an Atlas V.

And for the SpaceX crew delivery they showed EFT-1.

Ridley Scott may be a great director, but not a rocket scientist.

- - - Updated - - -

Yes, it looked like a fat Cygnus/PMM combo launched on a CZ-2. We're doing it the way Weir said it looked.

Well that's stupid. So even at 1:16 in the first trailer, that's a different rocket?

He probably doesn't know about Delta, Titan, etc...

Well, he had helpers..... As I said, they probably decided to keep costs down by not creating rockets that do not yet exist.
